intro: Solivaea, commonly known as the meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soil. Solivaea has heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a hardy perennial that can thrive in temperate climates.
